info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 3:13PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN HUNTINGDON AND CENTRAL BLAIR COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 313 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Altoona, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Altoona, Hollidaysburg, Tyrone, Bald Eagle, Lakemont, Bellwood, Warriors Mark, Duncansville, Tipton, Spruce Creek, Birmingham, Franklinville, Horseshoe Curve, Sinking Valley, Canoe Creek State Park, Tunnelhill, Alexandria, Newry, Peoples Natural Gas Field and Penn State Altoona. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
